intro: Gonolobus hispidus, commonly known as the hairy gonolobus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with a distinctive hooded structure. Gonolobus hispidus is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats.
